content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: it's a good puzzle.... the constraints limits are higher than the test cases but the whole puzzle is good.
for me the natural way to solve that would be using flooding algo, so I think medium is good

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: nice one but i also agree with what DeanTheMachine said about the difficulty. my ruby solution:
```
w, h = gets.split.map &:to_i
g = h.times.map{gets.chomp.chars}
puts [g, g.transpose].sum { |grid|
  grid.each_cons(2).sum { |r1, r2|
    r1.zip(r2).map { _1 != _2 }.chunk(&:itself).count(&:first)
  }
}
```

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Might be a little too easy for medium but it's borderline.

Goal
* Please change "Mondriaan" to "Mondrian" for consistency.

* Please illustrate using an example with a brief explanation of how strokes are counted.

Goal / Input
* The description of "letters / each letter representing a different rectangle" may not be entirely accurate, because two separate rectangles may be denoted using the same letter (example: "Four rectangles" test). My suggestions:

(a) Goal: Please add:
The same letter may be reused for multiple distinct rectangles.

(b) Input: Please change "each letter representing a different rectangle" to:
each string representing one line of the painting

Goal
* Please change "each rectangles" to "each rectangle".

* Please change "to have" to "when counting".

Input
* Please change "describing" to "for the width and height of the painting".

Cases
* Please name all the validators.

* Validators which are the same as their corresponding tests right now should be revised.

Thanks.

Thanks for your feedback!

I've revised the goal and input following your comments. Also added more tests, including actual paintings for "immersion".

What do you think?

Thank you for following up my earlier comment. Regarding the updated version:

Input
* Please change "each letter representing a different rectangle" to:
each string representing one line of the painting

Cases
* Untitled composition by Piet Mondrian (test): The width is 14 instead of 15.

* Validator 5: Please name the case.

* Please remove the trailing newline at the end of the input:
  â€¢ Three rectangles (validator)
  â€¢ Four rectangles aligned (test)
  â€¢ Four rectangles aligned (validator)
  â€¢ Four rectangles not aligned (test)
  â€¢ Four rectangles not aligned (validator)
  â€¢ More complex shapes (test)
  â€¢ Validator 5

* These cases are the same and should be revised:
  â€¢ Four rectangles aligned (test / validator)
  â€¢ Four rectangles not aligned (test / validator)

Thanks again.

Input
* done

Cases
* Untitled composition by Piet Mondrian (test): done (validator was wrong too, I fixed it)
* Named balidator 5
* Removed all trailing EOL
* Changed validators to different shapes

Thanks again for your time. Let's submit it ðŸ¤žðŸš€

No problem ðŸ™‚

One last point: you may consider adding [[N]] > 0 to Constraints section (or alternatively, adding cases where [[N]] = 0).
